intro: Trigonella elliptica var. brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-seed fenugreek, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. Its fruit is a slender, cylindrical pod that matures to a dark brown color, containing several small, kidney-shaped seeds. This variety is distinguished by its shorter, more compact fruit compared to other Trigonella species.
